briefTitle: Safety and Efficacy of Nonacog Beta Pegol (N9-GP) in Previously Untreated Patients With Haemophilia B
officialTitle: An Open-label Single-arm Multicentre Non-controlled Phase 3 a Trial Investigating Safety and Efficacy of Nonacog Beta Pegol (N9-GP) in Prophylaxis and Treatment of Bleeding Episodes in Previously Untreated Patients With Haemophilia B (FIX Activity Below or Equal to 2 Percent)
summary: This trial is conducted globally. The aim of the trial is to investigate the safety and efficacy of nonacog beta pegol (N9-GP) in previously untreated patients with Haemophilia B.

primaryOutcome.measure: Number of Participants With Incidence of Inhibitory Antibodies Against Coagulation Factor IX (FIX) (50 Exposure Days)
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: When minimum 20 previously untreated patients (PUPs) have reached at least 50 exposure days (ED) (up to 156 weeks)
